  Source   Edit

Defines s sprite camera element. This is a way to display arbitrary sprites inside your game. Each sprite camera has a list of sprites to display, and a rectangular area (canvas) they all are supposed to occupy. In the GUI, sprite camera displays all the sprites in the list, possibly aligning the canvas inside the space that the sprite camera occupies (for example, it can center the view if the space given to the camera is too small to fit all the sprites). It also contains colliders as children, which can detect mouse clicks or mouse entering or leaving their area.

Imports

../ecs, ../helpers, ../primitives, ../../utils, ../../sprite, ../../collider

proc newSpriteCamera(sprites: seq[SpriteId]; rect: IRect;
                     vAlign: VAlign = VCenter; hAlign: HAlign = HCenter;
                     width: int = LengthUndefined; height: int = LengthUndefined): GuiElement {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}

Creates a sprite camera element.

Note that it doesn't contain any colliders yet and you should add them with add proc.
